Reviews.Title: “Good location but too expensive and one cann't feel very safe,and absolutely not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Bassman1988
Reviews.Content: Good location on the sea of marmara and a lot of fish restaurants around, if u have a chance go to beyti Restaurant by cab, costs about 10 Turkish Lera one way from hotel. But overall too expensive for the Rooms and poor services.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: shiftless
Reviews.Content: The Airport Inn Hotel YeÅŸilkÃ¶y Marina is ideally situated for travellers who donâ€™t want to stay downtown while doing a stopover in Istanbul. The cab ride to Ataturk Airport is short and YeÅŸilkÃ¶y is a calm, relaxing place after the hectic pace of Istanbul. While I love Istanbul as a city, sometimes I need a break from its frantic pace. As the name suggests, the hotel is situated directly across the road from the YeÅŸilkÃ¶y Marina, which provides pleasant views. For the small price difference, Iâ€™d suggest a sea view room. YeÅŸilkÃ¶y itself has lots of green space along the waterside and doesnâ€™t seem to get a lot of western tourists. Consequently, prices are lower than in Istanbul proper and strolling along through the parks provides a pleasant diversion. The hotel is not fancy, but we found it to be a clean, comfortable mid-range establishment, with a number of good fish restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The main street of the area, Istasyon Caddesi, is 10 minutes away. Should you wish to take a train into Istanbul, the journey from YeÅŸilkÃ¶y to Sirkeci station takes about 40 minutes. Our rooms were a good size (especially by European standards) and the en-suite showers had lots of water pressure. Windows can be opened to catch the breeze off the ocean and we found the area to be very quiet at night. Iâ€™m told that the hotel provides a pick-up service from Ataturk airport, but we didnâ€™t have a chance to use it, owing to our having confused this hotel with the Airport Inn Boutique Hotel, where we went initially. Fortunately the two hotels are within walking distance of each other. One caution â€“ the hotel has no lift; something to consider if youâ€™re on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Please beware”
Reviews.Author: 877toad
Reviews.Content: I had to stay on a business trip for two weeks, and in the end insisted that I was moved. The hotel is old, dirty, feels un-safe and the rooms are awful. I asked to be moved several times and all rooms are the same. The beds are small singles and at 6ft 2 they were not long enough or wide enough. I pushed two beds together and they could not provide me with a double sheet. Every night I woke up cold with single sheets not covering me. I was also intimidated by the staff into eating in the hotel, when the options outside are wonderful in the local area. If the hotel is closed and re-fitted then you may decide to give this one a try ! Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Two star hotel but five star location”
Reviews.Author: Gerry96
Reviews.Content: Nobody would claim that the Airport Inn is luxurious but if you want somewhere close to the airport and in a nice lively area, you will hardly find better. Located at Yesilkoy Marina, it is small family style hotel right on the harbour at the end of a row of popular and stylish restaurants, with many more in the nearby streets. Hotel amenities reflect the modest â‚¬65 room (incl breakfast) charge but they will pick you up at the airport, there is free Wi-Fi and the location is a vast improvement over most of the other airport hotels, which are often stuck in the middle of nowhere. The only real drawback is that the area's popularity can make it a bit noisy on a summer's night but it quietens down at a reasonable hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean, did not feel safe”
Reviews.Author: drcwatkins
Reviews.Content: We were booked here through a travel agency and I think that the agency must have made a mistake. I wonder if they meant to book us into the Airport Hotel. The Airport Inn Hotel is a completely different type of hotel and not the same quality as the other hotels on our trip. The two hotels have similar names but are completely different. The Airport Inn Hotel was not as near the airport as I expected. They placed my children in a room on another floor across the hotel from our room even though the hotel had many empty rooms. The carpets looked like someone had glued old blankets on the floor. There was an open electrical socket with wires jutting out in contact with one of my children's beds. The bathrooms had calk falling out and did not appear clean. We did not try to use the TV, but it appeared to be from several decades ago. It had those old-fashioned dials on it. I went back and forth from my children's room to our room several times and noticed several odd things. The doors of many of the rooms were standing open. Most of the open rooms appeared unoccupied, but one was standing open lights off and with clothing, and open suitcases on the beds. The place did not smell good. I did not feel safe there so I stayed awake all night and checked on my kids several times. I moved my son's bed away from the outlet with the wires sticking out. The people who drove us to and from the hotel appeared to work for the hotel. They said that they were going to charge us for the trip to the airport but when I insisted on looking at their booking and asked to call the booking agency, they agreed that they were not supposed to charge us for the trip. A small bottle of water cost 4 turkish lira.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing rooms, old and seedy, very kind and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bfs16
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night between flights. Happily we arrived late and left early so did not need to spend much time in room.

Reviews.Title: “an average family-owned small hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: amows
Reviews.Content: I am British and I was on a short trip to Istanbul with an early morning flight back to the UK so I decided to stay at a hotel near to the airport for the night before my flight. 1) The hotel is small and very average in all respect but the area (Yesilkoy, Marina of Yesilkoy) is quite good actually. Lots of posh Turkish restaurants nearby with a view of the sea. Great place to walk and spend the last night of your trip if you have an early plane to catch and you want to leave the city! 2) You can make it to Istanbul's AtatÃ¼rk Airport with taxi in less than 15 minutes and that will cost you exactly 12 TL with the taximeter on. Ask the driver specifically to turn the taximeter on otherwise he will ask for 15 TL! 3) The staffs are OK and polite. The Internet is Free but slow. The Phone and the TV sets are very old and maybe from the Second World War! Room was clean but basic, and I was not satisfied with the bathroom which is small. 4) One night is going to cost you 55 Euro include the breakfast. I didnâ€™t have time to try their breakfast but I would not expect anything especial anyway. 5) I wouldnâ€™t recommend it for more than one night. And if you want to pay more (around 100 euro) I would say the WOW hotel is the wiser choice.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: SeaBee77
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel ever! It was so scary that me and my husband did not sleep at all. There was only one other guest who looked like he was just out of prison. The sheets and towels were stained. Shower was so bad that we didn't even shower. There is a restaurant next door and all the noise and fried fish smell filled the room. But we couldn't keep the windows closed because it was extremely hot! There was one little television from the last century and it had two channels - barely. We ended up leaving around 4:00 am to wait at the airport instead. And paid 80 Euro per person for this. I am Turkish, and believe me, this is not acceptable. Not for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing--but the location is lovely”
Reviews.Author: KimberlySofia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a stopover to break up the long trip from Central Asia to the US. I'll start with the positive: The rooms are decent, clean and spacious. We liked the location so much (in a posh suburb with lots of cafes, and a promenade along the marina) that we didn't even venture into the center of Istanbul. We were quite pleased with the place--until we tried to go to sleep, and smelled the heavy cigarette smoke from a nearby room, which seemed to be coming directly through the walls. The other problems came as we checked out in the morning. Before arrival, I had confirmed via email that the van transfer back to the airport was 15TL. The young man at reception confirmed this when we arrived at the hotel. But when we were preparing to leave the next day, suddenly the price became 20TL! The hotel employee (who was also the van driver) said that 15TL was the price for a regular taxi, not the hotel van, which, if true, had not been made clear at all. He also charged me for a local phone call that his colleague, a very nice young woman, had told me the evening before was free of charge. After this kind of "customer service," I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: talltaff
Reviews.Content: I expected to be staying right next to the runway when I booked this hotel in order to fly home the next day. I was surprised to be taken to Yeslikoy (a 5 min drive away), a lovely suburb on the coast which was buzzing on a Saturday night and had a nice atmosphere on a Sunday morning with locals walking along the marina. There are lots of nice cafes, bars and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and some plesant places to walk around in the daytime. The hotel is basic and a bit dated but clean and comfortable, breakfast was a good standard and the staff were very helpful and friendly. A very nice way to end my trip to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ObservantPerson
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights whilst on business in this small, "family type" hotel. I booked it as it was close to the Expo Centre in Istanbul, and whilst by the sea, it was only a 15 minutes taxi ride from the Expo, so ideal. The room was clean, if a little tired, but the air conditioning and fan worked perfectly. The bathroom was in need of a new shower as the shower head did not fix into the wall bracket, so a bit of a pain! I ate in the hotel on 2 evenings and was overall satisfied with the quality. The breakfast was standard cold buffet style, and the coffee was good quality and very, very hot. The staff were so friendly and helpful, they couldn't have done anything more to assist me.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel in a delightful little town”
Reviews.Author: texastraveler59
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night but found the Airport Inn Hotel a delight. Our room was spacious and clean with a view of the sea. They had installed new double paned windows so it was very quiet. Our room looked like it has been recently redone with new carpet and bedding. The hotel was on the water earlier in the century, and is quite a grand place with a beautiful marble curved staircase. The staff was very hospitable and got up in the middle of the night to take us to the airport. We stayed there because it was close to the airport, but thoroughly enjoyed out stay. The marina is beautiful. There is a quaint old church a couple of blocks away with outdoor restaurants in the streets behind it. And the little town has historic houses and numerous restaurants and stores.

HotelInfo.Name: Airport Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Yesilkoy Marina, Rihtim Cad No: 21, Istanbul, Turkey
